thread.title: Mike Pence Finds Himself in Unusual Role in Mike Flynn’s Firing - WSJ
thread.title_full: Mike Pence Finds Himself in Unusual Role in Mike Flynn’s Firing - WSJ

author: Peter Nicholas
title: Mike Pence Finds Himself in Unusual Role in Mike Flynn’s Firing - WSJ
text:
Politics Mike Pence Finds Himself in Unusual Role in Mike Flynn’s Firing Vice president played role in ouster, but also wasn’t told of national security adviser’s deceptions for two weeks in loose-knit White House structure By @CarolELee Feb. 15, 2017 7:38 p.m. ET 
Mike Pence showed his clout inside the White House with the Monday firing of Mike Flynn, who allowed the vice president to espouse false information about the national security adviser’s conversations with Russian officials. 
But Mr. Pence also learned he remains very much a junior partner in the still-forming White House power structure, as a timeline shows President Donald Trump knew about Mr. Flynn’s deceptions for two weeks without informing his No. 2. The warning from the Justice Department about Mr. Flynn’s... RELATED VIDEO Trump Administration Faces New Questions Over Russia The resignation of National Security Adviser Mike Flynn is raising new questions, after it emerged that the Trump administration was aware last month that he misled Vice President Mike Pence about conversations he had with the Russian ambassador about U.S. sanctions.
